TopicTitle: Out of Curiosity: Is this why we have the Mohole?

Articles.Content:
Curiosity struck me when i was watching Phils Crash Course on Mercury.

[https://youtu.be/P3GkZe3nRQ0?t=8m35s](https://youtu.be/P3GkZe3nRQ0?t=8m35s)

Were those Coldtraps the Intention to put the Moholes where they are right now or did they originate from a glitch in the Terrain-Mesh?

Would be great to get an answer to that ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I'm pretty sure the Mohole exists because rectangular-to-polar conversion causes exaggerated features at the poles, actually...

My official explanation/theory-because-I-don't-remember: There's a slightly darker single row of pixels at the pole of Moho on the heightmap (aka, the top/bottommost rows of pixels on it), which causes a sudden drop in altitude at that point. You could make a Mo-Hoop *around* the pole instead by moving said darkened row down a ways.

It wasn't an intentional feature. Still, happy accidents and all that.

So it WAS a "happy accident" that actually had a Counterpart in the real Solarsystem.

Thats pretty neat ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks for your recollection, Nova.

Has a developer actually stated that it was accidental?

I have always assumed, dangerous I know, that it was a tribute to the Russian 'Mohole' experiment. I guess I thought that they put it there after naming the planet.

NovaSilisko was a dev ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) if Nova says that's why i have no reason to disbelieve.

Pretty cool formations though.

Cold traps aren't a unique feature to Mercury. The moon has them as well.

All you need for a cold trap is a crater at the poles of the body. Most atmosphere poor bodies should have these.
